briefdescription.para: typedef to Traits::Point_d.

detaileddescription.para: Point type used to represent the input points.

briefdescription.para: typedef to Traits::FT.

detaileddescription.para: Number type used to return the squared radii of the smallest enclosing annulus.

briefdescription.para: typedef to Traits::ET.

detaileddescription.para: Number type used to do the exact computations in the underlying solver for quadratic programs (cf. Implementation).

briefdescription.para: non-mutable model of the STL concept RandomAccessIterator with value type Point.

detaileddescription.para: Used to access the points of the smallest enclosing annulus.

briefdescription.para: non-mutable model of the STL concept RandomAccessIterator with value type Point.

detaileddescription.para: Used to access the support points of the smallest enclosing annulus.

briefdescription.para: non-mutable model of the STL concept RandomAccessIterator with value type Point.

detaileddescription.para: Used to access the inner support points of the smallest enclosing annulus.

briefdescription.para: non-mutable model of the STL concept RandomAccessIterator with value type Point.

detaileddescription.para: Used to access the outer support points of the smallest enclosing annulus.

briefdescription.para: non-mutable model of the STL concept RandomAccessIterator with value type ET.

detaileddescription.para: Used to access the coordinates of the center of the smallest enclosing annulus.

briefdescription.para: initializes min_annulus to $ ma(\emptyset)$.

memberdef.argsstring: (InputIterator first, InputIterator last, const Traits &traits=Traits(), int verbose=0, std::ostream &stream=std::cout)
memberdef.name: Min_annulus_d

briefdescription.para: initializes min_annulus to $ ma(P)$ with $ P$ being the set of points in the range [first,last).

parameterdescription.para: is a model of InputIterator with Point as value type.

simplesect.para: All points have the same dimension.

briefdescription.para: returns the dimension of the points in $ P$.

detaileddescription.para: If min_annulus is empty, the ambient dimension is $ -1$.

briefdescription.para: returns the number of points of min_annulus, i.e. $ |P|$.
returns the number of support points of min_annulus, i.e. $ |S|$.
returns the number of support points of min_annulus which lie on the inner sphere.
returns the number of support points of min_annulus which lie on the outer sphere.
returns an iterator referring to the first point of min_annulus.
returns the corresponding past-the-end iterator.
returns an iterator referring to the first support point of min_annulus.

simplesect.para: $ ma(P)$ is not degenerate, i.e., number_of_support_points() is at least one.

briefdescription.para: returns the corresponding past-the-end iterator.

simplesect.para: $ ma(P)$ is not degenerate, i.e., number_of_support_points() is at least one.

briefdescription.para: returns an iterator referring to the first inner support point of min_annulus.
returns the corresponding past-the-end iterator.
returns an iterator referring to the first outer support point of min_annulus.
returns the corresponding past-the-end iterator.
returns the center of min_annulus.

detaileddescription.para:
An implicit conversion from ET to RT must be available.
min_annulus is not empty.

briefdescription.para: returns the squared inner radius of min_annulus.

detaileddescription.para:
An implicit conversion from ET to RT must be available.
min_annulus is not empty.

briefdescription.para: returns the squared outer radius of min_annulus.

detaileddescription.para:
An implicit conversion from ET to RT must be available.
min_annulus is not empty.

briefdescription.para: returns an iterator referring to the first coordinate of the center of min_annulus.

simplesect.para: The coordinates have a rational representation, i.e. the first $ d$ elements of the iterator range are the numerators and the $ (d\!+\!1)$-st element is the common denominator.

briefdescription.para: returns the corresponding past-the-end iterator.
returns the numerator of the squared inner radius of min_annulus.
returns the numerator of the squared outer radius of min_annulus.
returns the denominator of the squared radii of min_annulus.

description.para: The bounded area of the smallest enclosing annulus lies between the inner and the outer sphere.
The boundary is the union of both spheres. By definition, an empty annulus has no boundary and no bounded side, i.e. its unbounded side equals the whole space $ \E^d$.

briefdescription.para: returns CGAL::ON_BOUNDED_SIDE, CGAL::ON_BOUNDARY, or CGAL::ON_UNBOUNDED_SIDE iff p lies properly inside, on the boundary, or properly outside of min_annulus, resp.

simplesect.para: The dimension of p equals min_annulus.ambient_dimension() if min_annulus is not empty.

briefdescription.para: returns true, iff p lies properly inside min_annulus.

simplesect.para: The dimension of p equals min_annulus.ambient_dimension() if min_annulus is not empty.

briefdescription.para: returns true, iff p lies on the boundary of min_annulus.

simplesect.para: The dimension of p equals min_annulus.ambient_dimension() if min_annulus is not empty.

briefdescription.para: returns true, iff p lies properly outside of min_annulus.

simplesect.para: The dimension of p equals min_annulus.ambient_dimension() if min_annulus is not empty.

briefdescription.para: returns true, iff min_annulus is empty (this implies degeneracy).
returns true, iff min_annulus is degenerate, i.e. if min_annulus is empty or equal to a single point.
resets min_annulus to $ ma(\emptyset)$.
sets min_annulus to $ ma(P)$, where $ P$ is the set of points in the range [first,last).

parameterdescription.para: is a model of InputIterator with Point as value type.

simplesect.para: All points have the same dimension.

briefdescription.para: inserts p into min_annulus.

simplesect.para: The dimension of p equals min_annulus.ambient_dimension() if min_annulus is not empty.

briefdescription.para: inserts the points in the range [first,last) into min_annulus and recomputes the smallest enclosing annulus.

parameterdescription.para: is a model of InputIterator with Point as value type.

simplesect.para: All points have the same dimension. If min_annulus is not empty, this dimension must be equal to min_annulus.ambient_dimension().

description.para: An object min_annulus is valid, iff

min_annulus contains all points of its defining set $ P$,
min_annulus is the smallest annulus containing its support set $ S$, and
$ S$ is minimal, i.e. no support point is redundant.
Note: In this release only the first item is considered by the validity check.

briefdescription.para: returns true, iff min_annulus is valid.

detaileddescription.para: If verbose is true, some messages concerning the performed checks are written to standard error stream. The second parameter level is not used, we provide it only for consistency with interfaces of other classes.

briefdescription.para: returns a const reference to the traits class object.
writes min_annulus to output stream os.

detaileddescription.para: An overload of operator<< must be defined for Point.

briefdescription.para: reads min_annulus from input stream is.

detaileddescription.para: An overload of operator>> must be defined for Point.

briefdescription.para: An object of the class Min_annulus_d is the unique annulus (region between two concentric spheres with radii $ r$ and $ R$, $ r \leq R$) enclosing a finite set of points in $ d$-dimensional Euclidean space $ \E^d$, where the difference $ R^2-r^2$ is minimal.

detaileddescription.para: For a point set $ P$ we denote by $ ma(P)$ the smallest annulus that contains all points of $ P$. Note that $ ma(P)$ can be degenerate, i.e. $ ma(P)=\emptyset$ if $ P=\emptyset$ and $ ma(P)=\{p\}$ if $ P=\{p\}$.

An inclusion-minimal subset $ S$ of $ P$ with $ ma(S)=ma(P)$ is called a support set, the points in $ S$ are the support points. A support set has size at most $ d+2$, and all its points lie on the boundary of $ ma(P)$. In general, the support set is not necessarily unique.

The underlying algorithm can cope with all kinds of input, e.g. $ P$ may be empty or points may occur more than once. The algorithm computes a support set $ S$ which remains fixed until the next set, insert, or clear operation.

Traits
must be a model for OptimisationDTraits.
We provide the models Optimisation_d_traits_2, Optimisation_d_traits_3, and Optimisation_d_traits_d using the two-, three-, and $ d$-dimensional CGAL kernel, respectively.

The problem of finding the smallest enclosing annulus of a finite point set can be formulated as an optimization problem with linear constraints and a linear objective function. The solution is obtained using our exact solver for linear and quadratic programs [7].

The creation time is almost always linear in the number of points. Access functions and predicates take constant time, inserting a point takes almost always linear time. The clear operation and the check for validity each take linear time.
